data.title: Real Underwater Hockey
data.meta_description:
This is a shot of me dressed in full field hockey goalie gear in a pool ... I wanted to do a fundraiser T-shirt to raise money to travel to California for the world championships in 1998. This shot with "Real Underwater Hockey" or something like that. 
	
	I borrowed the field hockey gear from a workmate (who I had many great conversations about what "real" hockey actually was).  What I didn't really think about was just how totally and utterly buoyant this gear was!  Absolutely no hope of getting underwater in this gear!
	
	The photo was taken by a good friend of mine, Garry Davidson, who sadly passed away last year.  Taken at the Glenorchy Pool near Hobart, Tasmania.  After a hard training session, we spent quite a bit of time getting the shot right - lighting was tricky, I was stuck to the surface, and we used good old slide film (so we basically had no idea whether it worked or not).
	
	I never used the image however - I used an action uwh image of a friend of mine and sold enough at the world championships to have a little bit of spending money.
data.text:
This is a shot of me dressed in full field hockey goalie gear in a pool ... I wanted to do a fundraiser T-shirt to raise money to travel to California for the world championships in 1998. This shot with "Real Underwater Hockey" or something like that.

I borrowed the field hockey gear from a workmate (who I had many great conversations about what "real" hockey actually was). What I didn't really think about was just how totally and utterly buoyant this gear was! Absolutely no hope of getting underwater in this gear!

The photo was taken by a good friend of mine, Garry Davidson, who sadly passed away last year. Taken at the Glenorchy Pool near Hobart, Tasmania. After a hard training session, we spent quite a bit of time getting the shot right - lighting was tricky, I was stuck to the surface, and we used good old slide film (so we basically had no idea whether it worked or not).

I never used the image however - I used an action uwh image of a friend of mine and sold enough at the world championships to have a little bit of spending money.
